"Les plans ont peu d’importance mais la planification est essentielle."

Winston Churchill

Our method

The SEVEN method is all about the following precepts in order to create a meaningful experience for every participants and trainers. All precepts are equally important in a well-designed training program.


Catching the attention of every participants

By giving rhythm. The right rhythm. Adjusted for the participants. By alterning between lessons and exercices and creating a dynamic learning framework.

In pratice, SEVEN Training Managers sequence workshops in several 15 to 25 minutes long modules, thus maintaining a high level of attention among the participants.


Calling upon the various types of intelligence.

Each of these modules uses one or more types of intelligence, as defined by Howard Gardner. Switching between types keeps every participant involved and focused.

In practice, SEVEN Training Programs use alternately kinesthetic awareness, interpersonal exchanges, etc...


Setting the right level of energy.

The participants energy levels often match the trainer's. Hence finding the right amount of energy is crucial, as well as choosing the right trainer for the job, according to their profile and ability to share knowledge and expertise.

In practice, every trainer we bring to our clients has various professional activities and multiple perspectives and skills.


Making every content understandable and exploitable.

We are entrepreneurs. We select and convey the best contents to our participants. We create our trainings to be of direct impact on the participants' work.

In practice, we offer simple yet effective, pragmactic, proven and operational tools.


Repeating for long term memorization.

Teaching is all about repetition. SEVEN contents are repeated and rephrased time and again, in different manners. During the training and between sessions so it is well remembered by the participants.

In practice, SEVEN Training Programs are built on long periods, either instructor-led or e-learning, thus helping participants in a comprehensive learning experience.

The team

Since its start, SEVEN has gathered a community of 95 passionated trainers and experts. Their various profiles allow us the make unique teams, fit to lead creative and entertaining trainings.


Here are some of our Seveners :

THOMAS FRAUDET

Optimisme et mise en relation Emotions et expression des intuitions Prudence et pensée critique

As a consultant in Innovative Pedagogy, Thomas creates and develops custom-made trainings and courses for schools and companies. He is director for the Master of Business Development in NEOMA Business School.

Former Financial Officer at L'Oreal and Web Entrepreneur, he specializes in negotiation, entrepreneurship, creativity and oral communication.

Graduate from ESSEC and Norges Handelshøyskole (NHH), he loves to participate in conferences as a speaker, in France or abroad.


Follow Thomas on :

MATHILDE MEURER

Emotions et expression des intuitions Optimisme et mise en relation Organisation et prise de recul

Convinced that diversity is a treasure, Mathilde has worked in the field of disability for 5 years alongside Axel Kahn and Pascal Jacob, as a communications manager.

Graduate from 3A School in Lyon, in marketing and humanitarian logistics, she is always looking for meaningful professional experiences, focused on human relations.

Mathilde is a trainer in communications, tech innovations, creativity, entrepreneurship, networking and management for companies (INTEL, PWC, DELIVEROO) and schools (NEOMA, EMN, ESSEC).

Mathilde is in charge of developing SEVEN network in the south west of France and is head of operations. She is also licensed from TEDXBordeaux 2019/2020.


Follow Mathilde on :

BRICE CHAPUIS

Organisation et prise de recul Neutralité et information pure Emotions et expression des intuitions

Taking interest in project management and digital development, Brice used his analytical mind and his optimization capabilities working for Longchamp Japan and Nokia. He favors efficiency and reciprocal respect through human relations and diplomacy.

Having studied Mathematics and Web Development, he now builds digital tools at SEVEN.


Follow Brice on :

YAHYA FALLAH

Optimisme et mise en relation Neutralité et information pure Organisation et prise de recul

Expert in entrepreneurship, management and negotiation, Yahya has founded three companies in various lines of business (counsel, textiles, agribusiness). He has a unique vision of social business and collaborative economy.

Former manager of an investment fund and trader, he has a precise knowledge of financial challenges, at macro and company level.

Graduate from NEOMA Finance Master and Clarkson University MBA (New York, USA), he has significant experience in financial intercultural and company development issues.


Follow Yahya on :

JORICK ROUSTAN

Emotions et expression des intuitions Optimisme et mise en relation Créativité débordante

Jorick's passion for collective and personal development knows no limit, and he feels constantly amazed by the wonders of social diversity.

After graduating from the KEDGE Business School Marseille and NEOMA Business School Paris, and thanks to the experience gained from working in Sales at Coca-Cola and The Walt Disney Company, Jorick focus nowadays on passing on his knowledge of management in an efficient and accessible manner.

As an ambassador from Enactus Marseille since 2011, he worked on three different social and entreprneurial projects, and won the Enactus national competition with his team.
He takes great interest in the evolution of teaching methods.


Follow Jorick on :
